required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reader Study to Demonstrate That Use of ClearRead Confirm is Superior to the Use Standard AP/PA X-ray Image
clinical_study.official_title: Reader Study to Demonstrate That Use of ClearRead Confirm is Superior to the Use Standard AP/PA X-ray Image. AP Stands for Antero-Posterior. PA Stands for Postero-anterior.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study to determine whether or not a new type of software is, or is not, of benefit. The software, ClearRead Confirm, is designed to enhance the ability of radiologists to detect tubes, lines and wires that may be placed within a patients chest. These types of devices are commonly used for very sick patients in intensive care units and are also used following surgery and in the treatment of cancer. This study will test radiologist's detection of the tips of these devices comparing the results with standard chest radiographs and the the modified chest radiographs. The primary interest is in the time used to interpret the radiograph. We will determine if there is any change in accuracy of detection.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary hypothesis: the amount of time used for the interpretation of these radiographs will not change. (null hypothesis)
Secondary hypothesis: there will be no change in the accuracy of the detection of the tips of venous catheters and tubes transiting the esophagus. (null hypothesis)

primary_outcome.description: Time for completion of tasks of identifying the tips of tubes, lines, and wires. Outlying values are excluded from the calculation of the mean values and standard errors. Outlying values were defined as those more than three standard deviations from the mean time.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in Detecting the Tips of Tubes, Lines, and Wires.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of accuracy in determining the location of the tips of nasogastric tubes (NG) (various types of nasogastric tubes combined) and of the tips of venous catheters (various types of venous catheters combined), compared to the determination of the expert panel. Measure is the distance from the median location determined by five experts in chest radiology.

other_outcome.description: Following the viewing of the test radiographs, the radiologists were asked a series of questions of overall preference. On this scale, 1 indicates strong disagreement, 5 indicates strongly agree. Ten statements were used. Note that a low value for the standard image is equivalent to a high value for the modified image.

arm_group.description: The radiologists will be viewing two groups of chest images. The first group are standard chest radiographs.
This group of chest radiographs will be presented with the modified image. The modified image is intended to increase the visibility of tubes, lines and wires on chest radiographs

study_pop.textblock: There are two populations: the radiologists and the cases they will review. For cases, these are sequential cases selected by database search using defined search criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For the radiologists, they must in in active practice of community radiology (non-university sites).
- For the cases, they must be patients who have a tube, line, or wire in their chest. A small number of completely normal bedside chest radiographs will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- For radiologists: Not in active practice. Working in a university hospital.
- For cases: children. Do not meet image quality criteria.

facility.name: Georgetown University Medical Center, Suite 603, 2115 Wisconsin Ave

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Ten Board Certified radiologists practicing in community (non-university) practice were recruited from the Washington, DC, - Baltimore, MD, Metropolitan region. Recruitment was by email and phone calls to prior participants in our studies and to other radiologists that they referred us to. Recruitment April, 2012 through September, 2012
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 54 cases were used to train the radiologists on the use of the data recording computer and to make them familiar with the appearance of the processed chest radiographs. These cases were not used in the test of reader performance.

group.title: Chest Radiographs
group.description: The radiologists will be viewing two groups of chest images. The first group are standard chest radiographs. The second group are the processed images. These radiographs were randomly placed into two groups. The radiologists were randomly placed in two groups. Each of these two groups interpreted half of the standard chest radiograph without processing and half with the special processing. The other group of radiologists interpreted the other half of the normal and the other half of the processed images. The radiologists reviewed each radiograph using one or the alternate presentation

participants_list.participants: The same 10 radiologists are interpreting images in both arms.

outcome.title: Time for Completion of Tasks
outcome.description: Time for completion of tasks of identifying the tips of tubes, lines, and wires. Outlying values are excluded from the calculation of the mean values and standard errors. Outlying values were defined as those more than three standard deviations from the mean time.
outcome.population: Each radiologist interpreted only half (158) chest radiographs. All of the radiographs were interpreted by a combination of the 10 radiologist participants.

group.title: Standard Chest Radiographs
group.description: The radiologists will be viewing two groups of chest images. The first group are standard chest radiographs. The second group are the processed images. These radiographs were randomly placed into two groups. The radiologists were randomly placed in two groups. Each of these two groups interpreted half of the standard chest radiograph without processing and half with the special processing. The other group of radiologists interpreted the other half of the normal and the other half of the processed images.

group.title: Modified Chest Radiographs
group.description: This group of chest radiographs will be presented with the modified image. The modified image is intended to increase the visibility of tubes, lines and wires on chest radiographs. Each radiologist interpreted half the images as conventional images and half as processed images.

measure.title: Time for Completion of Tasks
measure.description: Time for completion of tasks of identifying the tips of tubes, lines, and wires. Outlying values are excluded from the calculation of the mean values and standard errors. Outlying values were defined as those more than three standard deviations from the mean time.
measure.population: Each radiologist interpreted only half (158) chest radiographs. All of the radiographs were interpreted by a combination of the 10 radiologist participants.

outcome.title: Accuracy in Detecting the Tips of Tubes, Lines, and Wires.
outcome.description: Measurement of accuracy in determining the location of the tips of nasogastric tubes (NG) (various types of nasogastric tubes combined) and of the tips of venous catheters (various types of venous catheters combined), compared to the determination of the expert panel. Measure is the distance from the median location determined by five experts in chest radiology.

group.title: Standard Chest Radiographs
group.description: The radiologists will be viewing two groups of chest images. The first group are standard chest radiographs. The second group are the processed images. These radiographs were randomly placed into two groups. The radiologists were randomly placed in two groups. Each of these two groups interpreted half of the standard chest radiograph without processing and half with the special processing. The other group of radiologists interpreted the other half of the normal and the other half of the processed images.

group.title: Modified Chest Radiographs
group.description: This group of chest radiographs will be presented with the modified image. The modified image is intended to increase the visibility of tubes, lines and wires on chest radiographs. Each radiologist interpreted half the images as conventional images and half as processed images.

measure.title: Accuracy in Detecting the Tips of Tubes, Lines, and Wires.
measure.description: Measurement of accuracy in determining the location of the tips of nasogastric tubes (NG) (various types of nasogastric tubes combined) and of the tips of venous catheters (various types of venous catheters combined), compared to the determination of the expert panel. Measure is the distance from the median location determined by five experts in chest radiology.

class.title: NG tubes distance in centimeters vs experts

outcome.title: Likert-Like
outcome.description: Following the viewing of the test radiographs, the radiologists were asked a series of questions of overall preference. On this scale, 1 indicates strong disagreement, 5 indicates strongly agree. Ten statements were used. Note that a low value for the standard image is equivalent to a high value for the modified image.

group.title: Reading Time Estimate by Radiologists
group.description: The modified image will reduce reading time.

group.title: Pleural Drain Visibility
group.description: Pleural drains are easier to see on the standard image.

group.title: Venous Catheters
group.description: Venous catheters easier to see on modified image

group.title: Cardiac Related Wires
group.description: Cardiac related wires are easier to see on the standard image

group.title: Overall Image Quality
group.description: Overall image quality is superior on the standard image

group.title: Image Quality Radioopaque Regions
group.description: Image quality in the opaque image areas is superior on the confirm image

group.title: Confidence on Line Placement
group.description: The modified image increased my confidence with respect to line placement

group.title: Need for Window/Level Manipulation
group.description: The standard image required less window/level manipulation

group.title: Confidence on Tube Placement
group.description: The confirm image increases my confidence with respect to tube placement.

measure.title: Likert-Like
measure.description: Following the viewing of the test radiographs, the radiologists were asked a series of questions of overall preference. On this scale, 1 indicates strong disagreement, 5 indicates strongly agree. Ten statements were used. Note that a low value for the standard image is equivalent to a high value for the modified image.

reported_events.desc: Injuries to radiologists during study. No systematic assessment was made of injuries to the radiologists.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
